title: Bakers Delight handwriting font
content:
I know the chances are slim, but I thought I'd post it anyway.

It's the font Bakers Delight uses in their ads.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100528184107im_/http:/typophile.com/files/171_5671.jpg)

Thanks to anyone who can help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [171.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100528184107/http:/typophile.com/files/171.jpg) | 27.52 KB |
author: Liezl Yap

comments.content:
I have to leave now, but I would check [Part 11 of the Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20100528184107/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script11Pg1.html) (Everyday hand printing).

- Mike Yanega
If it's a font, it's one with a fair amount of alternates...

I think that it's certainly within the scope of the OpenType fonts to provide a number of alternates. MADType's [Casino Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20100528184107/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/casino-hand/casino-hand/characters.html) is one such font, although it is not the same as the posted sample. Another is Alejandro Paul's [Pronto](http://web.archive.org/web/20100528184107/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000316#characters). However, neither of these two fonts IS the font in question. I think it is a font because I see no more than two variations of any letters, which is certainly do-able in OpenType.

- Mike Yanega
